newsitem.title: USA: TouchStone Software adopts rights plan.
newsitem.headline: TouchStone Software adopts rights plan.

text.p: TouchStone Software Corp said Monday its board had approved the adoption of a shareholder rights plan with a 15 percent trigger.
The plan was not adopted in response to any takeover attempt, and no takeover proposals have been directed at the company, TouchStone said.
Under the rights plan, TouchStone stockholders will receive one preferred stock purchase right for each share of TouchStone common held, the company said.

The rights, which have an exercise price of $15 each, initially will trade with the company's common stock. The rights will not be exercisable until certain takeover-related events occur, the company said.
The rights plan becomes effective if a person or group acquires 15 percent or more of the company's common stock without the approval of the board.
At that time, the rights holders would be able to purchase additional shares of common stock having a market value equal to two times the exercise price of the right, the company said.
